DOC.HEADLINE: GERMAN SOLDIERS VISIT AUSCHWITZ
DOC.TEXT: The first uniformed Germans to visit the Auschwitz death camp in 50 years paid an emotional homage to the past on Sunday in a ceremony that also symbolized hopes for the future of united Europe . Some of the 60 soldiers and 35 officers of the Bundeswehr , the German army , were in tears as they toured the barracks that housed 1.5 million people killed by the Nazis at Auschwitz during World_War_II , including more_than 1 million Jews . Soldiers laid a wreath of red flowers .
